intro: Caiophora larensis, commonly known as the Laren's caiophora, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its ornamental, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, fertile soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
